scoring

Class DiceScore

  • java.lang.Object
    • scoring.Score
      • scoring.DiceScore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scorable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PigScore, YahtzeeScore

    public abstract class DiceScore
extends Score
    Author:
    Sara Wille The DiceScore class is designed to fascilitate scoring a generic dice game by counting the number of instances for each side of the Dice in the Hand. The instance variable scoringHand is a Hand object that can be set by calling the method countHandValues, which sets the Hand before running the calculation. The class must be inherited by a more specific GameScore class, which will include the equations for calculating the score of that specific game.

    • Method Detail

      • countHandValues

        public static void countHandValues(Hand thisHand)
        countHandValues() - After setting the scoringHand instance variable to the current Hand, the method loops through the Hand to count the number of times each value appears. The die face values and number of times each occurs are stored in the HashMap handValues.
        Parameters:
        thisHand -

        public abstract void updateScore(Hand newHand)
